topic.title: What happens if the owner of a Zite deletes its contents?
topic.body: If he deletes everything on his Zite and then signs and publish with his private key, when I connect to ZeroNet it will automatically copy the new emptyied Zite deleting the older content right? So, should I make regular backups of the Zites I actually care about?

1518793754_1D8nrvyX1Hwj1FvSvFWZWLsT8R48F.body:
It's pretty much dead https://www.reddit.com/r/antilibrary/comments/7pdwud/no_books_can_be_downloaded_all_ipfs_nodes_are_down/
But there is http://libgen.io which is great. It has been running for several years but who knows for how much longer? So you better go there and download all the books that matter for you, and if possible get the torrent file for every book and seed them to infinity, at least until these new technologies are more developed and a decentralized page the size of libgen is finally possible.

If you really have an account on bibliotik I don't even know why are you opening this thread. You are clearly deeper into the scene than I'll ever be.
But to answer your question, you can upload books on libgen through tor if you worry about being watched.
